fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Centrica sheds customers Centrica said yesterday its household gas business had lost more customers than expected following a price increase. The company said British Gas Residential had seen a net fall of 220,000 customers in the first four months of the year after the 5.9% rise in household gas and electricity bills in January. Securicor's profit rise Securicor has put in a strong first half performance with profits up 20% ahead of its planned £1.6bn merger with Danish rival Group 4 Falck. Pre-tax profits before one-off items and goodwill in the six months to March 31 at Securicor rose from £32.4m to £39m. Securicor and Group 4 Falck announced their plans for a nil-premium tie-up in February and merger documents are expected to be sent out in the next couple of weeks. Jury retires in Versailles trial A jury hearing the case against Carl Cushnie, founder of collapsed FTSE 250 company Versailles Group, retired yesterday morning to consider its verdict. Mr Cushnie is charged with two counts of conspiracy to defraud in relation to Versailles Group and Versailles Traders. The two firms, which provided financing for small companies, collapsed with multi-million pound debts in 2000 after it emerged accounts had been inflated by bogus transactions. The jury resumes its deliberations today. Bunzl wraps up Le Goff deal Bunzl, the British packaging group, has acquired the privately owned French cleaning and safety products distributor Groupe Pierre Le Goff for €236m (£166m), boosting its European business by a third. Bunzl, which already has operations in Benelux, Germany, Denmark and Ireland, said the acquisition "establishes a strong platform in a key European market at a time when the internationalisation of customers and suppliers is continuing". Le Goff made a €35.4m operating profit in 2003 on sales of €421.5m.
